intro: Kitagawia macilenta, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with short, fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Kitagawia macilenta thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded, humid areas.
